Description: The RoboCamp Teacher Plan provides 1 year of unlimited access to all RoboCamp courses, covering over 298 lesson plans across LEGO® Education sets. This includes 25 SPIKE Essential lessons and 85 SPIKE Prime lessons (Beginner, Intermediate, Expert, and Short). The plan also features WeDo 2.0, EV3, and 3D Printing & Laser Cutting courses. All future updates and new courses are automatically added to the teacher’s account. The subscription is intended for one teacher and their students.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Hardware_Required_list: At least one of: SPIKE Prime, SPIKE Essential, WeDo 2.0, Mindstorms EV3
Skill_Progression: Covers progression Across courses — from SPIKE Essential and SPIKE Prime Beginner to Expert and Python-level robotics.
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Comprehensive Access – All lessons across LEGO SPIKE Essential, SPIKE Prime, WeDo, and EV3.
Includes Updates & New Courses – Automatically added during the subscription.
Cost-Effective – Best value for individual teachers.
All-in-One Solution – From beginner to expert, with additional 3D Printing & Laser Cutting modules.

Description: The RoboCamp School Plan provides 1 year of unlimited access to all RoboCamp courses for all teachers in a school. It includes over 266 lesson plans, with 25 for SPIKE Essential and 65 for SPIKE Prime, plus WeDo 2.0, EV3, and 3D Printing & Laser Cutting. Any new lessons or courses released during the subscription are added automatically, ensuring the entire school benefits from the latest content.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: School principal, Program director, After-school owner
Hardware_Required_list: At least one of: SPIKE Prime, SPIKE Essential, WeDo 2.0, Mindstorms EV3
Skill_Progression: Covers progression Across courses — from SPIKE Essential and SPIKE Prime Beginner to Expert and Python-level robotics.
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Full School Access – All teachers can use RoboCamp materials.
Extensive Library – All lessons across LEGO SPIKE Essential, SPIKE Prime, WeDo, and EV3.
Continuous Updates – New courses and lessons included automatically.
Best Value for Schools – Cost-effective solution for multiple educators.
Future-Proof – Keeps the school’s robotics program modern and comprehensive.

Plan: SPIKE Essential Programming Course Early Learners
Description: The course includes 25 structured lesson plans ( 60 minutes each) introducing students to programming with Icon Blocks using LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential. Step by step, students build and code original robot designs while learning the basics of coding, sensors, and mechanics. The curriculum is designed for young learners, helping them develop fundamental programming and engineering skills in a fun and structured way, aligned with STEAM and 21st-century education standards.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Perfect for Beginners – Easy-to-follow curriculum tailored to early learners.
Comprehensive Content – 25 lesson plans designed for a full school year.
Practical Teacher Training – 2 hours of expert online training included.
Engaging Builds – Students create unique RoboCamp-designed robots like Crane, Owl, Car Race, and Goat.
Interactive Learning – Encourages creativity, problem-solving, and teamwork.

Description:
A course designed specifically for schools and programs working with 45-minute lessons, where weekly teaching time is limited. The program includes 25 ready-to-use lesson plans based on LEGO Education SPIKE Prime and the Word Blocks programming language, guiding students step by step through simple robot builds and core programming concepts.

From a programming perspective, the course partially overlaps with the Intermediate level, but it has been deliberately simplified and time-optimized so that each lesson can be completed within 45 minutes without time pressure or skipping essential learning stages.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Outcomes_list:
Students can independently build and program simple robotic constructions using LEGO Education SPIKE Prime.
They understand basic visual programming concepts (sequence, events, loops, simple conditions) in the Word Blocks language.
They program motors and basic sensors (force, tilt, color) and interpret input data in simple projects.
They connect basic robot mechanics with control logic, understanding the relationship between construction and behavior.
They are able to complete a full robotics lesson within a limited 45-minute timeframe, from building to testing.
They gain confidence working with robots and code, forming a solid foundation for further development with SPIKE Prime
Includes: 25 lesson plans optimized for 45-minute classes (SPIKE Prime, Word Blocks), step-by-step robot building and coding instructions, access for 1 teacher and students, 1-year access to the RoboCamp platform, one 2-hour online training session (live webinar + on-demand recording).
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Designed as a safe entry point with no assumptions about prior experience for either students or teachers. The “lesson-by-lesson” structure of 25 sessions systematically builds programming habits, understanding of robot mechanics, and confidence in working with sensors and control logic.

This is the best choice for schools operating on a 45-minute lesson schedule, where a full 90-minute program is not feasible. The course is intentionally condensed and simplified so that each lesson fits within limited class time, without sacrificing teaching quality or solid foundations for further development (e.g. FLL/WRO).

Description:
A complete and most universal programming course for LEGO Education SPIKE Prime, designed for 90-minute lessons. The course includes the full scope of the Beginner level and extends it with additional content that develops students’ programming and engineering skills to an intermediate level.

The program allows for calm, project-based work, full use of SPIKE Prime capabilities, and systematic skill development without time-related compromises.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Outcomes_list:
Students independently design and program more complex robot constructions, using the full capabilities of the SPIKE Prime set.
They confidently apply loops, conditional logic, variables, multitasking, and precise control of motors and sensors.
They analyze sensor data and use it to optimize robot behavior and solve practical, real-world problems.
They integrate mechanics, programming, and logical reasoning in projects designed for 90-minute lessons.
They test, debug, and iteratively improve their programs, understanding errors and algorithmic limitations.
They are prepared for a conscious transition to the advanced level, including text-based programming.
Includes: 25 lesson plans designed for 90-minute classes (SPIKE Prime, Word Blocks), full progression from beginner to intermediate level, access for 1 teacher and students, 1-year access to the RoboCamp platform, two 2-hour online training sessions (live webinars + recordings).
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
The most recommended and safest choice when a school or teacher has no strict time constraints and is unsure about the exact skill level of the group. The course covers the entire Beginner content and continues it toward a stable intermediate level.

It is a full, no-compromise program designed for regular 90-minute lessons, supporting programming skills, logical thinking, and project-based learning, while preparing students for a smooth transition to the advanced level.

Description:
An advanced course intended for students who have completed the Intermediate level and are ready to transition to text-based programming in Python. The course begins with parallel work in Word Blocks and Python, and then smoothly moves to Python-only programming.

The program also includes lessons introducing practical concepts of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI & ML), showcasing advanced capabilities of the SPIKE Prime set that are difficult or inefficient to implement using block-based programming alone.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Outcomes_list:
Students smoothly transition from block-based to text-based programming and independently create robot control programs in Python.
They design stable and readable algorithms using functions, data structures, and synchronous and asynchronous programming.
They implement robotic projects that are impractical or unstable in Word Blocks but natural and efficient in Python.
They understand and apply foundational concepts of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning in the context of sensor-driven robotics.
They build and program advanced mechanisms requiring precision, synchronization, and abstract algorithmic thinking.
They treat the robot as a computational platform rather than just a mechanical build, preparing for further programming education and advanced projects.
Includes: 25 advanced lesson plans (SPIKE Prime), programming in Word Blocks and Python, a gradual transition to Python-only work, 2 (soon 4) lessons introducing practical AI and Machine Learning concepts, access for 1 teacher and students, 1-year access to the RoboCamp platform, one 2-hour online Python-focused training session.
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
A natural next step after the Intermediate level, opening the path to more complex algorithms, more stable code, and advanced program structures. Python enables projects that are too complex, unreadable, or unstable when implemented in Word Blocks.

The AI and Machine Learning components introduce students to modern technological concepts and demonstrate real-world applications of AI in robotics, while maintaining a clear learning progression and continuity between course levels.

Plan:
3D Modelling
and Printing Course Parts for LEGO SPIKE Prime robots
Description: The course currently offers 7 lesson plans (expanding to 10) that teach students how to design and 3D print custom LEGO-compatible parts for SPIKE Prime robots. Using mainly Tinkercad, with selected lessons in Fusion 360 and Blender, students learn step by step how to model small, practical elements that can be quickly produced on a school 3D printer. By enhancing robots with original parts such as manipulators, turbines, or sensors, students experience both engineering creativity and the real-world use of digital fabrication tools. The course helps schools make effective use of their 3D printers, often underused due to the time-consuming nature of larger prints.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Practical 3D Printing – Focus on small, fast-to-print parts suitable for school settings.
Hands-on Digital Fabrication – Students learn Tinkercad, with additional exposure to Fusion 360 and Blender.
Boosts Creativity – Enhances standard LEGO robots with unique, student-designed elements.
Effective Use of School 3D Printers – Makes printing feasible within class schedules.
Expanding Curriculum – Beta version with 7 lessons now, regularly updated until full release (10 lessons).

Plan: 2D Modelling and Laser Cutting Course Parts for LEGO SPIKE Prime robots
Description:
The course currently offers 4 lesson plans (expanding to 10) that teach students how to design and laser cut custom wooden parts for LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Prime robots. Using Tinkercad for modeling, students create components that can be cut in just minutes, making laser cutting a faster and more practical alternative to 3D printing in the classroom. The wooden parts add both functionality and aesthetics, turning robotics into a cross-disciplinary experience that combines engineering and art (STAM).
This course is currently available in beta version, offered at a reduced price until the full curriculum of 10 lessons is completed.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Fast & Practical – Parts that take 40 minutes to 3D print can be laser cut in just 5 minutes.
Tinkercad Integration – Simple, student-friendly design workflow.
Beautiful Results – Wooden elements enhance robots with professional and artistic look.
Expanding Curriculum – Beta version with 4 lessons now, regularly updated until full release (10 lessons).
Beyond STEAM – Introduces art and design, transforming robotics lessons into STAM experiences.

Plan: WeDo 2.0 Programming Course Beginner to Advanced by RoboCamp
Description: The course includes 25 structured lesson plans (60 minutes each) for programming in LEGO® Education WeDo 2.0. Students build and code original robots while learning key concepts such as loops, variables, and sensor input through step-by-step instructions. The curriculum provides a full-year learning path, from simple projects to advanced problem-solving, helping students develop logical thinking, creativity, and engineering skills. Although LEGO has officially discontinued support for WeDo 2.0, the set can still be successfully used in schools, especially as a bridge between SPIKE Essential and SPIKE Prime, making it ideal for 8–9 year olds.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Comprehensive Curriculum – 25 lessons covering beginner to advanced programming skills.
Hands-on Projects – Engaging builds such as Motorcycle, Ferris Wheel, Owl, and Spirograph.
Perfect for Schools with WeDo 2.0 Sets – Helps educators fully utilize the potential of sets they already own.
STEAM Alignment – Develops problem-solving, logical thinking, and creativity.
Teacher-Friendly – Includes introductory online training and ready-to-use materials.
Great Transition Tool – Fits perfectly between SPIKE Essential (younger students) and SPIKE Prime (older students).

Plan: Mindstorms EV3 Programming Course: Classroom App
Description:
The course is built around the EV3 Classroom app (primary software version) and includes 24 structured lesson plans (90 minutes each) for programming LEGO® Mindstorms EV3.

In addition, the course provides a fully equivalent legacy-compatible version with 24 lesson plans adapted for the EV3 Lab software. The EV3 Lab materials are included as a compatibility option for schools still using the discontinued software and are not sold as a separate course.

Students build and program advanced robots while exploring mechanics, sensors, loops, variables, and multithreading. Although LEGO has officially discontinued Mindstorms EV3, many schools still use the hardware, and this curriculum allows them to fully unlock its educational potential.

Designed for older students, the course develops problem-solving, programming, and engineering skills, making it a natural continuation after WeDo or SPIKE Essential.
Audience_list: Primary school teachers, Middle school teachers, After-school providers, Camps & summer programs, STEM clubs / makerspaces, Private tutors, Parents / homeschool
Buyer_Role_list: Teacher, After-school owner, School principal, Program director
Includes:
24 structured lesson plans for EV3 Classroom (primary version)
24 equivalent lesson plans adapted for EV3 Lab (legacy version, included)
Ready-to-use teacher materials and student instructions
Robotics projects covering mechanics, sensors, logic, and multithreading
Why_This_Course_or_Plan:
Primary Classroom Curriculum – Designed around the EV3 Classroom app as the main and recommended software environment.
Legacy Software Support Included – Provides an equivalent EV3 Lab version for schools still using discontinued software, at no extra cost.
Full-Year Robotics Program – 24 Classroom lessons (plus legacy-compatible Lab version) structured for long-term progression.
Advanced Robotics Projects – Students build and program vehicles, cranes, sorters, and complex autonomous systems.
Extended Use of Retired Hardware – Enables schools to continue meaningful use of existing EV3 sets.
Strong Skill Progression – Develops programming logic, engineering thinking, and systematic problem-solving.
Natural Continuation Path – Ideal next step after WeDo or SPIKE Essential.
